headline: Costco (COST): Evaluating Valuation After Strong Q4 Sales, Earnings Beat, and Steady Membership Growth
summary: Costco Wholesale (COST) just delivered higher-than-expected sales and earnings in its latest quarter, showing strong digital and same-store sales gains alongside steady membership growth. Investors are closely watching what this could mean for the stock. See our latest analysis for Costco Wholesale. Costco has continued to expand its offerings, most recently by adding sought-after brands like Bobbie Organic Infant Formula to its shelves, and remains a retail bellwether for value-seeking...

headline: Costco Joins Dozens of Businesses Suing Over Trump's Tariffs
summary: While the Supreme Court weighs whether the import tariffs President Donald Trump imposed this spring using emergency powers are legal in a case brought by several small businesses, Costco has joined dozens of larger firms seeking relief of their own.  “This separate action is necessary,” the retail giant argues in its suit filed in U.S. International Trade Court Friday, because refunds are not guaranteed "for those unlawfully collected tariffs in the absence of their own judgment and judicial relief.”  Costco is considered less exposed to tariffs than many other retailers since just one-third of its sales in the U.S. come from imports and less than half of those come from Canada, China, and Mexico, Barron’s previously reported.

headline: Costco sues Trump administration over tariff refund eligibility
summary: Investing.com -- Costco Wholesale Corp. has filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration to secure eligibility for tariff refunds if the U.S. Supreme Court strikes down the president’s global tariffs policy.

raw.headline: Costco sues Trump administration over tariff refund eligibility
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Costco Wholesale Corp. has filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration to secure eligibility for tariff refunds if the U.S. Supreme Court strikes down the president’s global tariffs policy.

headline: Costco sues Trump admin seeking tariff refunds before Supreme Court rules if they're illegal
summary: Costco joined dozens of other companies that are seeking to protect their rights to refunds of Trump's tariffs without first waiting for the Supreme Court.

raw.headline: Costco sues Trump admin seeking tariff refunds before Supreme Court rules if they're illegal
raw.summary: Costco joined dozens of other companies that are seeking to protect their rights to refunds of Trump's tariffs without first waiting for the Supreme Court.

headline: Costco Joins Companies Suing for Refunds If Trump’s Tariffs Fall
summary: The nation’s biggest warehouse club chain is among dozens of companies to file lawsuits in a US trade court since late October challenging President Donald Trump’s use of an economic emergency powers law to impose the levies, according to court records.  The Supreme Court heard arguments on Trump’s tariffs on Nov. 5.  Costco’s lawyers wrote that the complaint, filed on Nov. 28 in the US Court of International Trade, was prompted due to the uncertainty that refunds will be guaranteed for all businesses that have been paying duties if the Supreme Court declares the tariffs unlawful.

Costco’s lawyers wrote that the complaint, filed on Nov. 28 in the US Court of International Trade, was prompted due to the uncertainty that refunds will be guaranteed for all businesses that have been paying duties if the Supreme Court declares the tariffs unlawful.

headline: How Recent Developments Are Rewriting the Story for Costco Wholesale
summary: Costco Wholesale's fair value estimate remains unchanged at $1,055.97. This reflects a steady view of its intrinsic worth despite shifting market dynamics. Analysts have made only minor adjustments to their models, with the discount rate edging lower to 6.95% and revenue growth projections holding firm at 7.45%. As opinions continue to evolve amid both optimism and caution, readers should stay tuned to see how future updates might further reshape the investment narrative for Costco. Stay...
